lead_paragraph: HOPKINS--Dr. Robert. The members of the Department of Surgery mourn the loss of Dr. Robert Hopkins, Professor Emeritus of Medical Science at Brown University and former surgeon and Acting Chief-of-Surgery at Miriam Hospital in Providence, RI. Beloved father of Dr. Mary Ann Hopkins, Robert became a surgeon, like his father and grandfather before him. Notably, Robert performed the first kidney transplant in Rhode Island in 1973. He was an active member of numerous medical societies, serving in leadership positions such as President of the American Cancer Society, Rhode Island Division, President of the New England Society for Vascular Surgery and President of the Society of Medical Consultants to the Armed Forces to mention a few. We extend our deepest condolences to Dr. Hopkins and her family on their loss. H. Leon Pachter M.D., F.A.C.S The George David Stewart Professor and Chair Department of Surgery NYU Langone Medical Center 1/3
